alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 16 at 10:43PM EST until December 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EST SUNDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Watch, one to two feet of inundation above ground level possible along shorelines and tidal waterways (8.1 to 8.3 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 9 AM EST Monday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from 8 AM EST Sunday through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Significant saltwater inundation will render numerous roads impassable. Properties may also flood. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 11:17 AM Sunday at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 16/11 PM 6.4 0.6 1.6 N/A None 17/11 AM 8.2 2.4 2.4 N/A Major 17/11 PM 4.3 -1.5 -0.5 N/A None 18/12 PM 5.1 -0.7 -0.5 N/A None 19/01 AM 3.9 -1.9 -1.1 N/A None 19/01 PM 5.0 -0.8 -0.3 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
